cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles NNE of Cabo Lucrecia, Cuba and 105 miles S of Long Island, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the Bahamas, then forecast to parallel the Southeast U.S. coastline and curve just offshore of Georgia-South Carolina, skirting near or just offshore the North Carolina coast late Saturday into Sunday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central Florida coast (near the North Palm Beach–Cape Canaveral corridor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch extends only to Fernandina Beach, FL (well south of North Carolina)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning currently North Palm Beach FL to Flagler/Volusia county line FL – no warnings yet north of Florida
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Southeast U.S. coastline from Florida through Georgia, South Carolina and up to coastal North Carolina (including Cape Fear area)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (40–60 mph) possible Saturday night into Sunday, with a low (10–14%) chance of sustained 50 kt winds if the center tracks closer
weather_observation.storm_surge: If Matthew passes just offshore, 3–5 ft inundation is possible along the lower Cape Fear River and adjacent beaches
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of heavy rain possible, producing local freshwater flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents and minor coastal erosion beginning late Friday, continuing through the weekend
